endpoints.name: Restore
endpoints.description: Description Restore a backup snapshot of the customers Mimecast configurations for: Managed Senders, Managed URLs and Profile Groups. The configurations can be restored in: Restore a backup snapshot of the customers Mimecast configurations for: Managed Senders, Managed URLs and Profile Groups. The configurations can be restored in: Append Mode - restores deleted entries by addition to the current hierarchy i.e., new entries after the backup are not deleted. Append Mode - restores deleted entries by addition to the current hierarchy i.e., new entries after the backup are not deleted. Append Mode Append Mode - restores deleted entries by addition to the current hierarchy i.e., new entries after the backup are not deleted. Overwrite Mode – restore deleted entries by replacing the current hierarchy i.e., new entries after the backup are deleted. Overwrite Mode – restore deleted entries by replacing the current hierarchy i.e., new entries after the backup are deleted. Overwrite Mode Overwrite Mode – restore deleted entries by replacing the current hierarchy i.e., new entries after the backup are deleted.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: array expand_less must contain  exactly 1 item

parameters.name: object expand_less backupType (required) string Type of snapshot. The following values are supported: managedsenders, managedurls, profilegroups. mode (required) string Restore mode. The following values are supported: append, overwrite. restoreSource (required) string Restore snapshot from source GUID. scope (required) object expand_less Scope of the restore. unit (required) string Scoped restore unit. The following values are supported: for managedsenders backupType: all, recipient. for managedurls backupType: all, blocked, permitted. for profilegroups backupType: all, groupid value array Scoped restore values. The following values are supported: for managedsenders backupType: an array of recipient email addresses. for managedurls backupType: N/A. for profilegroups backypType: the id of the profile group the operation is scoped to, taken from the backup file - note this value must be provided as an array, but this must be of length 1.

parameters.description: array expand_less must contain  exactly 1 item

endpoints.name: Get Performance Details
endpoints.description: Description This API endpoint can be used to get Awareness Training Mime | OS Training Module user level Performance details by Department and Performance Type (data displayed on Performance > Achievements Details). parameters.description: array expand_less must contain at most 1 item

parameters.name: object expand_less attributeIds array A list of Mimecast secure IDs for attributes to be used when searchBy is set to custome. A maximum of 3 attribute IDs can be provided. filterBy array expand_less Allows to filter by specific video counts. The fieldName should always be set to 'type' and the value should be one of video_count_0, video_count_1, video_count_2, video_count_3, video_count_4_or_more or video_count_all. The default value is video_count_all. object expand_more includeUserDetails boolean If set to true, user details will be included in the response. When customAttribute is used, the attributeIds array becomes required. object expand_more

endpoints.name: Find Processing Messages
endpoints.description: Description This API endpoint will return messages currently being processed by Mimecast. Given the speed at which messages are processed, it is not uncommon for this endpoint to return no results, as the platform may not be processing a message at the moment or request. More information on the Processing Queue can be found in Mimecaster Central . This API endpoint will return messages currently being processed by Mimecast. Given the speed at which messages are processed, it is not uncommon for this endpoint to return no results, as the platform may not be processing a message at the moment or request. More information on the Processing Queue can be found in Mimecaster Central Mimecaster Central Mimecaster Central . All request fields are optional, however at least one option must be presented in the request body. endpoints.name: Services
endpoints.description: Description When the customer subscribes to Internal Email Protect, Continuity or Archiving we need to ensure that internal messages (that normally remain internal to the customers' email infrastructure) get copied on their infrastructure (i.e. Journaled) and this copy needs to be provided to their Mimecast account. On their Mimecast account, the message needs to be processed by a Journal Connector. Such a Journal Connector uses a specific hostname per Mimecast region. Response should have the hostname the journal items should be forwarded to. When the customer subscribes to Internal Email Protect, Continuity or Archiving we need to ensure that internal messages (that normally remain internal to the customers' email infrastructure) get copied on their infrastructure (i.e. Journaled) and this copy needs to be provided to their Mimecast account. On their Mimecast account, the message needs to be processed by a Journal Connector. Such a Journal Connector uses a specific hostname per Mimecast region. Response should have the hostname the journal items should be forwarded to. This endpoint is used to create  journaling connector. This endpoint is used to create  journaling connector.

parameters.name: description (required)
parameters.description: string A description to identify the new journaling service.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: boolean Whether the new journaling service is to be enabled on creation.

parameters.name: messageFormat
parameters.description: string Format of the journal messages to be sent - standard_eml (standard EML), exchange_env (Exchange envelope). The following values are allowed: standard_eml, exchange_env Default value "exchange_env"

parameters.name: removeJournalHeaders
parameters.description: boolean If true, Mimecast will remove any X-MS-Exchange-Organization-BCC and X-MS-Exchange-CrossPremises-BCC headers that Microsoft Exchange has added. Default value false

parameters.name: journalNonInternalAddresses
parameters.description: boolean If true, items processed by the journal connector that do not hold an internal addresses will be archived nonetheless. Default value false

parameters.name: journalUnknownInternalAddresses
parameters.description: boolean If true, items processed by the journal connector that are sent from or to unknown internal addresses will be archived nonetheless. Default value false

parameters.name: smtpJournalingConnection (required)
parameters.description: object expand_less Details for a new SMTP journaling connection.

parameters.name: emailAddress (required) string (email) The address of the email account created for SMTP journaling should be the same format for all journaling services example - journaling@journal.<your domain>.com. The domain varies according to the service used. ipRanges array IP address ranges that are allowed to submit messages to the new SMTP journal service. These are in addition to your customer account's authorized outbound IP addresses, which are allowed by default. Must be IPv4 in CIDR format. usesAuthentication boolean Whether to require password authentication for the new SMTP connection. Authentication requires an SMTP/Send Connector on the Exchange server. Default value false password string (password) Password for SMTP journaling. This is required if SMTP authentication is to be enabled. usesTls boolean Whether to encrypt the connection with Transport Layer Security (TLS). Default value true prefersClearText boolean Set to true for Active Directory protected journal items. Default value false extendedDeduplication boolean Only set this to true if internal messages are to be journaled via remote/local infrastructure as well as delivered via the Mimecast Gateway. If true, Mimecast will wait 10 minutes for the Gateway item after having received the internal message via the journal connector before removing duplicate messages. Not required during a Continuity Event. Default value false deliveryWaitAttempts number The number of times the system attempts to match a message before it is archived. 0 ≤ value Default value 3 inactivityTimeout number If there is no journal activity for this many minutes, the service status changes to ERROR. 180 ≤ value ≤ 960 Default value 180 processInitialDelay number The duration in minutes to wait before attempting to match a message to the archive. 0 ≤ value Default value 0

If true, Mimecast will wait 10 minutes for the Gateway item after having received the internal message via the journal connector before removing duplicate messages. Not required during a Continuity Event. Default value false deliveryWaitAttempts number The number of times the system attempts to match a message before it is archived. 0 ≤ value Default value 3 inactivityTimeout number If there is no journal activity for this many minutes, the service status changes to ERROR. 180 ≤ value ≤ 960 Default value 180 processInitialDelay number The duration in minutes to wait before attempting to match a message to the archive. 0 ≤ value Default value 0

parameters.name: emailAddress (required)
parameters.description: string (email) The address of the email account created for SMTP journaling should be the same format for all journaling services example - journaling@journal.<your domain>.com. The domain varies according to the service used.

parameters.name: ipRanges
parameters.description: array IP address ranges that are allowed to submit messages to the new SMTP journal service. These are in addition to your customer account's authorized outbound IP addresses, which are allowed by default. Must be IPv4 in CIDR format.

parameters.name: usesAuthentication

parameters.name: inactivityTimeout

parameters.name: pop3JournalingConnection (required)
parameters.description: object expand_less Details for a new POP3 journaling connection.

parameters.name: emailAddress (required) string (email) Email address of the journal mailbox. This must be different for each journaling service. mailbox (required) string The username to use when logging into the journaling mailbox. password (required) string (password) The password to use when logging into the journal mailbox. host (required) string Hostname or IP address where the journaling mailbox is housed.  Your firewall must be configured to allow inbound POP3/POP3S traffic from Mimecast to this address. port number The TCP/IP port to use for journal message transfer. Standard value is 995 (POP3S) or 110 (POP3). 1 ≤ value ≤ 65535 Default value 995 usesPOP3S boolean Whether the connection should be encrypted and journal messages pulled only using POP3S. Default value true encryptionIsRelaxed boolean Relaxed encryption permits encryption self-signed certificates and other valid certificates that may not have a complete trust chain. Default value false detailedLoggingIsEnabled boolean Enabling helps Mimecast Support to troubleshoot a failed journaling inbox. Default value false
parameters.description: emailAddress (required) string (email) Email address of the journal mailbox. This must be different for each journaling service. mailbox (required) string The username to use when logging into the journaling mailbox. password (required) string (password) The password to use when logging into the journal mailbox. host (required) string Hostname or IP address where the journaling mailbox is housed.  Your firewall must be configured to allow inbound POP3/POP3S traffic from Mimecast to this address. port number The TCP/IP port to use for journal message transfer. parameters.name: processInitialDelay
parameters.description: number The duration in minutes to wait before attempting to match a message to the archive. 0 ≤ value Default value 0

endpoints.name: Update Policy With Targets
endpoints.description: Description This endpoint can be used to update an existing Web Security Block or Allow List policy for domains or URLs. This endpoint can be used to update an existing Web Security Block or Allow List policy for domains or URLs. The Block or Allow List API endpoint enforces the existing 5,000 limit for total URLs supported in a policy and 25,000 limit for a customer account. This API is intended to automate low volume, day-to-day transactions and is not intended for use of bulk imports or large initial imports of domains or URLs. The Block or Allow List API endpoint enforces the existing 5,000 limit for total URLs supported in a policy and 25,000 limit for a customer account. This API is intended to automate low volume, day-to-day transactions and is not intended for use of bulk imports or large initial imports of domains or URLs. For more information about Web Security Policies, visit Mimecaster Central . For more information about Web Security Policies, visit Mimecaster Central Mimecaster Central Mimecaster Central .

Optional filtering fields can also be used to return a specific URL, or set of URLs. This endpoint can be used to return all entries currently in an accounts Managed URL list. Optional filtering fields can also be used to return a specific URL, or set of URLs. Note: Each account has a maximum URL entry limit. To get more information on your accounts current limit, please reach out to your Customer Success Manager, or your regional Customer Success Desk. Note: Each account has a maximum URL entry limit.
